result.execSummary:
The defendant Tabatha S. Mailo-Podewils was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in  Chapter 961, or go upon any premises where they believe such contraband may be present.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
D.A. John Snider appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Lennon.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The state moves to amend the sole count of the information to party to the crime of possession of heroin, per Sec. 939.05 and 961.41 (3g)(am), which is a Class I felony.
Defendant enters a please of no contest to the amended charge. Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant was found guilty.
Statements by counsel.
The Court orders that sentence be withheld, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. Conditions:
Pay all costs and fees.
Submit to any assessments or counseling deemed appropriate by the agent and abide by all treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Ch. 961, or go upon any premises where they believe such contraband may be present.
Defendant shall complete 25 hours of community service.
Appeal rights, voter and firearms restrictions were provided.
Received a call from defendant and Atty. Lennon requesting to have matter rescheduled she had surgery and is very out of it.

James Fassbender, ADA present
Attorney William Lennon present
Defendant present
Complaint received, reading waived
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing
Court questions defendant
Court finds defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause exists and binds matter over for arraignment to branch 1
Information to be filed within 10 days
Waive reading and receipt of information
Plea - not guilty
$3,000.00 signature bond
Conditions:
Shall report immediately to Sheriff's Dept. for booking.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Ch 961.
No contact directly or indirectly with J. A.
Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician.
STC to be scheduled
